name: 10 Average Questions about The Book of Psalms

questions.text: According to Psalm 119:164, why did David praise God seven times a day?
questions.explanation:
'Because of Thy Righteous Judgement'.

	Psalm 119:164, written by David, says, 'Seven times a day do I praise thee because of Thy righteous judgments'.

questions.text: In Psalm 86:1, what body part did David ask the Lord to "bow down" because he was poor and needy?
questions.explanation:
ear.

	David wrote in Psalm 86:1, 'Bow down thine ear, O Lord, hear me: for I am poor and needy'.

questions.text: With what word does the book of Psalms begin?
questions.explanation:
Blessed.

	Psalms 1:1 begins 'Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly. Nor standeth in the way of sinners. Nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful'.  The word 'Psalms' can also be found in Luke 20:42 and Acts 1:20.

questions.text: From what chapter does the King James quote 'Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil' come?
questions.explanation:
Psalm 23.

	Psalm 23 is known as the Shepherd's Psalm. The Psalm contains six verses.

questions.text: The middle verse of the King James Bible was placed in the book of Psalms. What Psalm is this verse in?
questions.explanation:
Psalm 118.

	Psalm 118:8, which says, 'It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man', is the middle verse of the King James Version of the Bible. Psalm 117 has the distinction of being both the shortest chapter and the middle chapter of the King James Version of the Bible.

Psalm 119.

	Psalm 119 is an acrostic poem containing one-hundred seventy six verses.

questions.text: Psalm 101:4 says, 'A _______ heart shall depart from me: I will not know a wicked person'. What word completes the King James Version quote?
questions.explanation:
froward.

	Froward is another word for perverse. 'A froward heart shall depart from me: I will not know a wicked person'. Psalm 101 is an old-fashioned, age-old challenge to godly living for all believers.

questions.text: In Psalm 19:10, God's word is sweeter than what?
questions.explanation:
'Honey and the honeycomb'.

	Psalm 19:10 says, 'More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb'.

questions.text: What is the missing word in Psalm 78:35, 'And they remembered that God was their _____ and the high God their redeemer' (King James Version)?
questions.explanation:
rock.

	Psalms 78, 105 and 106 are considered historical Psalms since they talk about the history of Israel.

questions.text: What tree are the righteous compared to in Psalm 92:12-14 of the King James Bible?
questions.explanation:
Cedar.

	The cedar of Lebanon is mentioned seventy-five times in the Bible. King Solomon used the cedar to build his temple. The tree was saturated with resin and the inside was the color of red. Isaiah referred to the cedar of Lebanon as 'high and lifted up'.
